content.prompt:
​

  • The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. 
  • The graph consists of four connected line segments.
  •  Moving from left to right:
  • The graph begins at (negative 1 comma negative 2).
  • The graph continues through the origin and to the point (1 comma 2).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (1 comma 2) to (2 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (2 comma negative 1) to (3 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (3 comma negative 1 to (4 comma 0), at which it ends.

 

​The graph of the function f{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is given. If g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is the function given by gx=2x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, which of the following is the graph of the composite function y=fgx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

choices.label:
​

  • The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. 
  • The graph consists of four connected line segments.
  •  Moving from left to right:
  • The graph begins at (negative 1 comma negative 1).
  • The graph continues through the origin and to the point (1 comma 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (1 comma 1) to (2 comma negative 0.5).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (2 comma negative 0.5) to (3 comma negative 0.5).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (3 comma negative 0.5) to (4 comma 0), at which it ends.

​

  • The x axis ranges from negative 2 to 8 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. 
  • The graph consists of four connected line segments.
  •  Moving from left to right:
  • The graph begins at (negative 2 comma negative 2).
  • The graph continues through the origin and to the point (2 comma 2).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (2 comma 2) to (4 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (4 comma negative 1) to (6 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (6 comma negative 1) to (8 comma 0), at which it ends.

​

  • The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The graph consists of four connected line segments.
  •  Moving from left to right:
  • The graph begins at (negative 1 comma negative 4).
  • The graph continues through the origin and to the point (1 comma 4).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (1 comma 4) to (2 comma negative 2).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (2 comma negative 2) to (3 comma negative 2).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (3 comma negative 2) to (4 comma 0), at which it ends.

​

  • The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. 
  • The graph consists of four connected line segments.
  • Moving from left to right:
  • The graph begins at (negative 0.5 comma negative 2).
  • The graph continues through the origin and to the point (0.5 comma 2), at which it ends.
  • The graph includes the line segment from (0.5 comma 2) to (1 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (1 comma negative 1) to (1.5 comma negative 1).
  • The graph includes the line segment from (1.5 comma negative 1) to (2 comma 0).

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
